channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The hedge by the old Pop in Parlour in Graham Road has not been cut and there are bramble bushes with spikes all overflowing which which dangerous and requires cutting back., 1st July
item.description:
The hedge by the old Pop in Parlour in Graham Road has not been cut and there are bramble bushes with spikes which is all overflowing which is dangerous and requires cutting back. Resident is concerned this could scratch and injure residents walking past, so please can this be cleared as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Graham Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes dumped in River Lea, 1st July
item.description:
People are dumping Lime Bikes into the river. Go past Hackney Henge heading West, turn right and go to lookout over river, look down to see bikes.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lea Bridge Road, Leyton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains a weed all over the pavements, 1st July
item.description:
Drains have been blocked for 3 YEARS. IF COUNCIL DONT DO THEIR JOBS PROPERLY I WILL STOP PAYING MY COUNCIL TAX I WRITTEN 3 TIMES AND COUNCILS JUST DONT CARE.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grantbridge Street, Islington, London

item.title: Street cleanse request o/s 159 Crayford Way, 1st July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Way, Barnes Cray, London

item.title: Hugh new mast erected, 1st July
item.description:
Over night a high mast has been erected in halfway street, it is an absolute eyesore and completely not suitable for a residential street. I cannot believe this has had permission to go ahead, I live down the road and I certainly have had no notice of this or the opportunity to object. To build on to your property, plans need to be kept inline with surrounding properties, how has this been allowed? I’m sure I will not be the only one complaining.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 188A, Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Harrowgate Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Overhanging vegetarian from 24- 18 Burham Close, 1st July
item.description:

item.title: Very dangerous paving and broken paved area, 1st July
item.description:
Uneven and broken broken paving and asphalt outside entrance to scrap metal merchants and in and around the bus shelter.Not helped by the fact that vehicles from the scrap merchants have taken it upon themselves to park and off load scrap in the immediate area and pavement..
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Avenue, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet
